title: Flipped Learning-Based Social Education Program for Strengthening 21st-Century Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary education field experience and foundational social studies competencies
context.additional_context: Blended education for in-service elementary teachers conducted at corporate training centers

learning_goals: Design social studies lessons that foster 21st-century competencies (creativity, critical thinking, etc.) using the flipped learning model, achieving at least 80% proficiency.
Evaluate the competency to operate blended learning classes that combine digital resources and face-to-face activities, achieving an average score of 3.2 or higher on a 4-point scale (1-4).
The ability to design collaborative activities among learners and provide feedback is verified at least three times through formative assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
